items.summary: Spotify Wrapped is back for 2025, with Bad Bunny taking the top spot for global artist for a fourth time.

items.title: Jimmy Barnes: The story behind Working Class Man and his American dream
items.summary: Cold Chisel was over. America beckoned. And Jimmy Barnes was terrified. This is the story of the album that made him, and the song that saved him.

items.title: EU's former diplomat Federica Mogherini charged in 'fraud and corruption' probe
items.summary: European prosecutors are investigating suspicions of fraud related to an EU-funded training scheme for junior diplomats.

items.title: Footballer sacked, youth worker charged after 'last-minute' intel leads to drug drop police sting
items.summary: A regional Victorian footballer and youth worker are facing drug trafficking charges after being caught with a package allegedly containing illegal drugs.

items.title: First community-designed, culture-led home from new outback housing initiative arrives in Tennant Creek
items.summary: A one-of-a-kind home, designed with the input of Tennant Creek families, has rolled up the Stuart Highway from Adelaide on a convoy of trucks. It is part of a new initiative aiming to transform housing in remote First Nations communities.

items.title: Tasmania's local and state governments to pay $650,000 for Foo Fighters concert in Launceston
items.summary: Tasmania's "biggest concert ever" will take place at Launceston's York Park next month when American rock band Foo Fighters play their only Australian show.

items.title: Is it better to sleep naked or wear pyjamas in summer?
items.summary: What you wear to bed can affect the quality of your sleep. And if that's nothing at all, there are a few things to consider.

items.title: Michael and Susan Dell donate nearly $10 billion to 'Trump accounts' for children
items.summary: Tech billionaires Michael and Susan Dell have pledged $US6.25 billion ($9.5 billion) to new investment accounts for children, known as "Trump accounts". Here's how the donation will work.

items.title: Bruce Lehrmann loses appeal against failed rape defamation case as lawyer hints at High Court challenge
items.summary: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found on the balance of probabilities he raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins in 2019.

items.title: What happened to Lisa Lynn? The untold story of Greg Lynn's first marriage and his wife's sudden death
items.summary: Long before Greg Lynn was convicted of murder in Victoria's High Country, his estranged wife died suddenly at home in Mount Macedon. Now, some of those closest to Lisa Lynn are pushing for the coroner to re-examine her death.

items.title: Pat Cummins eyeing early return from injury in Gabba Test with Josh Inglis poised for Ashes debut
items.summary: Australian skipper Pat Cummins is pushing for an early return from injury in the second Test in Brisbane while Josh Inglis will be making his Ashes debut.

items.title: What time does the Gabba Test start? How to watch the Ashes, and Brisbane weather forecast
items.summary: The second Ashes Test is upon us and we have fingers crossed it will last more than two days. Here's everything you need to know.

items.title: Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson surprise patrons with impromptu performance at Aussie pub in NYC
items.summary: Hugh Jackman sung the crowd-pleaser Sweet Caroline and even climbed onto the top of the bar counter for the performance.

items.title: Council says warnings ignored about tree removal in Central West Orana REZ
items.summary: The NSW government is being accused of wilfully ignoring warnings about the destruction of hundreds of native trees as part of a renewables project.

items.title: Crystal Fabergé egg shatters record, fetching $46m at auction
items.summary: The Winter Egg is made from finely carved rock crystal, covered in a delicate snowflake motif wrought in platinum with 4,500 tiny diamonds.

items.title: Peter Scammell charged with murder, extradited over 2020 death of nurse Katrina Hawker in Palmerston
items.summary: A 44-year-old man has been charged with murder over the death of his partner near Darwin, and has been extradited from Victoria ahead of his first appearance in the Darwin Local Court.

items.title: Hopes remain for return of eagles to relocated nest at Bundaberg Hospital site
items.summary: A wedge-tailed eagle's nest was moved in an operation costing about $100,000 involving a 60-tonne crane, a specialist arborist and a carefully engineered basket.

items.title: Sabrina Carpenter slams White House for using her music in ICE video
items.summary: Two-time Grammy winner Sabrina Carpenter slams the White House for using her song in a social media post about ICE raids, telling the Trump administration to never involve her in its "inhumane agenda".

items.title: Sam Kerr praised in Matildas return as Australia beats New Zealand 2-0
items.summary: Sam Kerr makes her long-awaited return to the Matildas on home soil as Australia downs New Zealand 2-0.

items.title: WA Police Arson Squad pinpoint ignition point of Geraldton bushfire that destroyed home
items.summary: Police offer up a $25,000 reward as they try to determine the cause of a blaze that tore through 160 hectares of land, left two homes uninhabitable and completely destroyed another in Geraldton.

items.title: Backpackers and PALM scheme workers scrambling for jobs after Dicky Bill shutdown
items.summary: Backpackers and PALM workers in Victoria and Queensland are looking for new jobs following the shock shutdown of Dicky Bill Australia.

items.title: NSW Police response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing to be probed by watchdog
items.summary: The independent body in charge of overseeing NSW Police misconduct allegations will today probe the response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing in 2023.

items.title: Proton therapy cancer unit debacle leads to $US32 million lawsuit

items.title: Environment Protection Authority to monitor Ballarat Gold Mine amid air pollution concerns
items.summary: Ballarat Gold Mine has exceeded national standards for potentially dangerous air pollutants.

items.title: Australia's day-night Ashes Test against England comes months after a demolition of West Indies
items.summary: The last time Australia played a Test with the pink ball, the brilliance of Mitchell Starc and Scott Boland turned the game into a farce.

items.title: Today in history, December 3: Bhopal gas leak kills thousands in world's worst industrial accident
items.summary: It started with a cloud of gas in the dead of night, silently submerging the city in a toxic soup. By morning on December 3, 1984, an Indian city awoke to a nightmare.

items.title: MPs to probe Crown Estate property portfolio after Mountbatten-Windsor lease revelations
items.summary: MPs in the United Kingdom will investigate the Crown Estate, after revelations Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor — Queen Elizabeth II's second son — had not paid rent for two decades sparked outrage.

items.title: End to war in Ukraine 'no closer' after US-Russia talks
items.summary: The Kremlin says a resolution to the war in Ukraine is "no closer" after a meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and two of Donald Trump's most powerful envoys.

items.title: WA Electoral Commissioner Robert Kennedy resigns months after problem-plagued state election
items.summary: Robert Kennedy tends his resignation as WA electoral commissioner, nine months after a state election that was plagued by issues including long wait-times to vote, and polling booths running out of ballot papers.

items.title: ACT legislates commitment for public servants to uphold 'Closing the Gap principle' in Australian first
items.summary: Senior ACT public servants will soon be required to demonstrate their work towards ending the inequality experienced by First Nations people.

items.title: Ravensthorpe deputy shire president Mark Mudie killed in West River fire
items.summary: A farmer who died trying to stop a "treacherous" fire from destroying his family's property in WA's south is identified as the local town's deputy shire president.

items.title: Usman Khawaja ruled out of Brisbane Test following back injury, Travis Head set to open
items.summary: Australia will be without veteran opener Usman Khawaja for the second Ashes Test after the 38-year old was ruled out due to an ongoing back problem.

items.title: England trio Ben Stokes, Mark Wood and Jamie Smith spotted riding e-scooters without helmets in Brisbane
items.summary: England captain Ben Stokes and several teammates have been spotted in Brisbane riding e-scooters without helmets ahead of the second Ashes Test.

items.title: My daughter has two mums. I'm her other mother
items.summary: Even though I am Evie's favourite — I am, after all, the fun mum — I can't shake the feeling that when it comes to serious mothering, I'm the spare. Her back-up mum.

items.title: Beekeepers warn of food price increases amid varroa mite battle in South Australia
items.summary: Beekeepers say the escalating cost of pollinating crops will be passed onto consumers as the industry battles a devastating bee killer.

items.title: Right to repair reforms to be expanded to farm machinery
items.summary: After years of depending on dealership networks for essential repairs, farmers will have the right to fix their own equipment.

items.title: Farmer killed fighting West River bushfire near Ravensthorpe on WA's south coast
items.summary: A man is killed while trying to establish a firebreak to help tackle a blaze near Ravensthorpe along WA's south coast, with the premier describing his death as "devastating".

items.title: Western Bulldogs former number one AFLW pick Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner wants to join North Melbourne
items.summary: The Kangaroos' domination of the AFLW is set to be given another boost, with a former number one draft pick confirming she wants to head to North.

items.title: Submarine tour, roof protest and shark encounter feature in our top WA photos for November
items.summary: Our photographers cast their eyes towards WA's exploding rabbit population, a surfer's near-miss with a suspected great white shark, and a school program helping parents bond with their children.

items.title: Princess Aiko's popularity sparks calls to ditch male-only succession law in Japan
items.summary: Historically, Japan has had numerous women monarchs. But current laws prevent the emperor's daughter from succeeding him — and politicians, including the prime minister, support the status quo.

items.title: South Australian farmers fear future as bird flu recovery causes egg oversupply
items.summary: The industry was plagued by bird flu 12 months ago, but some producers are now struggling to sell their product due to a faster-than-expected recovery.

items.title: Geraldton resident Nick Morgan grateful for support after losing home in bushfires
items.summary: A home owner who lost his house and his cat to a bushfire in Geraldton, in WA's Mid West, says "karma" is looking for anyone who may have deliberately lit the blazes.

items.title: Filmmaker breaks decades of silence over Yolŋu clan leader's alleged murder by police
items.summary: Acclaimed filmmaker George Gittoes has revealed a former NT police officer told him he witnessed his colleagues taking a Yolŋu clan leader out to shoot him and dump his body in Darwin Harbour in 1934.

items.title: Andrew Lethlean undecided on whether to challenge Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East
items.summary: Nationals favourite Andrew Lethlean is tight-lipped on whether he will challenge Premier Jacinta Allan in Bendigo East next year.

items.title: As teacher shortages loom across Australia these Queensland schools are trialling solutions
items.summary: As staff shortages "near crisis point", these Queensland schools are going to extraordinary lengths to put teachers in classrooms — and keep them there.

items.title: The numbers and narrative behind Australia's staggering pink ball success
items.summary: Day-night Test cricket provides Australia with one of the most potent home advantages in the history of the sport. Ten years into its existence, these are the numbers behind the format, its best performers and the ways England could spring an upset in Brisbane.

items.title: Tasmanians express mix of views ahead of final Macquarie Point stadium vote
items.summary: By the end of this week, Tasmania will know whether or not Hobart will have a new AFL stadium. Many Tasmanians are still making up their own minds about whether they support it or not.

items.title: Sam Kerr edges closer to injury return in final Matildas friendly vs New Zealand before Asian Cup
items.summary: Matildas captain Sam Kerr is running out of chances to make her long-awaited return from a knee injury, as the Australian team faces New Zealand's Football Ferns in their last scheduled match before next year's Asian Cup.

items.title: Popular and easy summer desserts
items.summary: Summer desserts are for sharing and we have 10 options for end-of-year gatherings and Christmas.

items.title: Ngangkaṟi share traditional healing in new edition of book that went global
items.summary: The Ngangkaṟi in Central Australia use traditional healing techniques to draw out illness with their hands. A new edition of their book aims to share this knowledge Western health workers.

items.title: Geraldton bushfire destroys one home as up to 200 firefighters worked to control blaze
items.summary: Authorities have downgraded their warning levels for bushfires burning in the greater Geraldton area to an 'advice' level after a challenging day for firefighters.

items.title: Opticomm customers across Australia losing free-to-air television and facing internet outages
items.summary: About 50,000 Australians are set to lose access to free-to-air television using their existing technology. And the troubles do not end there, with many customers also reporting regular and prolonged internet outages.

items.title: The Macquarie Point stadium decision is due this week — here's how it could play out
items.summary: The long-running debate over whether an AFL stadium should be built on Hobart's waterfront is reaching an end, as the parliamentary vote takes place this week.

items.title: Hinchinbrook by-election a tick of approval for LNP government but no crystal ball for outcome of next election
items.summary: A week is a long time in politics, let alone three years, and the LNP's success at the next election is by no means assured, writes Jack McKay.

items.title: Queensland to have brief break from heat and storms, with more forecast by weekend
items.summary: After a soaking November, this week could deliver a very brief reprieve from the storms and scorching heat.

items.title: England's Ashes demolition job of Australia in Brisbane's first ever cricket Test match at the Ekka
items.summary: Australia's Ashes domination in Brisbane is almost total, with England winless at the Gabba since 1986. It wasn't always like this though, with the first visit to Brisbane resulting in the heaviest defeat in cricket history.

items.title: Homes under threat as bushfire bears down on properties in Geraldton suburbs
items.summary: Lives and homes are again under threat from a bushfire burning in Western Australia's Midwest, with a fresh emergency warning issued in Geraldton's outer suburbs.

items.title: Spain's David Puig wins Australian PGA Championship by two strokes
items.summary: David Puig joins legendary countryman Seve Ballesteros as an Australian PGA champion after emerging from a congested field at Royal Queensland Golf Club in Brisbane.

items.title: Photographer Lyn Alcock captures wild antics of Dryandra's numbat population over 20 years
items.summary: Lyn Alcock is known as the 'Numbat whisperer', spending hours every day observing and photographing the tiny, endangered marsupials, recording behaviours that have never been seen before.

items.title: Em Rusciano on finding balance in life after her ADHD and autism diagnoses
items.summary: As a writer, singer, comedian, podcaster, author and single mum, Em Rusciano has become accustomed to navigating a chaotic life. The self-described "maximalist power queen" shares how she unwinds and how her approach to life has changed since going through perimenopause and being diagnosed with ADHD and autism.

items.title: LNP's Wayde Chiesa promises to get to work after victory in Hinchinbrook by-election
items.summary: The LNP's Wayde Chiesa will be the next representative for the Queensland seat of Hinchinbrook, which had been safely held by Katter's Australian Party since 2017.

items.title: Sydney FC great Alex Brosque fumes over alleged handball in Wanderers' 1-0 ALM win
items.summary: Sydney FC's four-match winning streak comes to a crashing halt, but its 1-0 loss to Western Sydney has sparked debate about what constitutes a handball.

items.title: British playwright and Oscar winner Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.summary: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation, with multiple awards for his work on stage and screen.

items.title: Sterile flies rain down on Kangaroo Island as battle to wipe out sheep blowfly gets serious
items.summary: Researchers on Kangaroo Island have been breeding and releasing millions of sterile Australian sheep blowflies in an attempt to eradicate the pest.

items.title: The spooky First Nations movie you need to see at BIFF
items.summary: First Nations stories are combined with modern horror scares in this new film from Australian creatives Chris Broadbent and Enzo Tedeschi.

items.title: Why Barbados became a republic and cut ties with the British monarchy
items.summary: With countries like Australia still debating whether or not the time has come to become a republic, what prompted tiny Barbados with its population of less than 300,000, to take the leap?

items.title: England captain Ben Stokes dismisses 'arrogant' label amid criticism of Ashes Test loss to Australia
items.summary: Captain Ben Stokes responds to England's critics in the wake of the defeat to Australia in the first Test, maintaining his squad will not step back from its aggressive approach.

items.title: Best books out in November, featuring Margaret Atwood's memoir and The Mushroom Tapes
items.summary: Wondering what to read next? This month's best books include a novel that brings to life Britain's only named wind and a new book by the author of The Handmaid's Tale.
